subject: Re: [junit] printing a TestResult
msgSnippet: ... Good. I just thought it was a trick question you were asking. :) -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416
messageBody:
Bauduin Raphael wrote:

> On Thu, Feb 05, 2004 at 02:30:48PM -0500, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >
> > Bauduin Raphael wrote:
> >
> > > Hi,
> > >
> > > I am running several different test suites with the same TestResult
> > > object to collect the results:
> > >
> > > suite(maxId).run(myTestResult);
> > >
> > > I now want to print the content if the TestResult object, but can't get
> > > it running (junit 3.8.1) with
> > >
> > > junit.textui.TestRunner myTestRunner = new
> > > junit.textui.TestRunner();
> > > myTestRunner.printFailures(myTestResult);
> > >
> > > I thought this would work, but I get
> > >
> > > TestDatabaseMigration.java:32: cannot resolve symbol
> > > symbol : method printFailures (junit.framework.TestResult)
> > > location: class junit.textui.TestRunner
> > > myTestRunner.printFailures(myTestResult);
> > >
> > >
> > > I'm sure I must have missed something obvious, but I can't seem to
> find
> > > it :(
> >
> > Apparently there is no method "printFailures(TestResult)" on class
> > TestRunner. I think the compiler message is pretty clear, don't you?
>
> I think it is pretty clear indeed, but I read this:
>
> http://www.junit.org/junit/javadoc/3.7/index.htm/overview-frame.html/allclasses-frame.html/junit/junit/textui/TestRunner.html#printFailures(junit.framework.TestResult)
>
> Hmmm, by pasting I just see it's not for the latest Junit release.....
>
> Well, I'll take a look at the ResultPrinter then.
>
> Thanks J.B.. Althought your mail contained no info, writing an answer to
> it helped me discover the obvious thing ;-)

Good. I just thought it was a trick question you were asking. :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
